meanings.definition: Change in color, especially to a less attractive or less pleasant one.
meanings.sent1: The discolored patch on the wall stood out from the rest of the paint.
meanings.sent2: The discolored leaves on the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The discolored balloon looked like it had lost its sparkle.
meanings.sent4: Her discolored mood matched the gloomy weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The discolored sky at sunset painted a beautiful but melancholic scene.

meanings.definition: To become stained or tainted in color.
meanings.sent1: The white shirt discolored after being washed with dark clothes.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph discolored over time, losing its original brightness.
meanings.sent3: The once vibrant painting discolored as the artist experimented with new techniques.
meanings.sent4: The water in the vase discolored as the flower petals started to wilt.
meanings.sent5: The metal gate discolored from exposure to the elements, turning a rusty brown.
